Hey!

When I changed from "g_list=[torch.DoubleTensor([1.0])]*size" to

" g_list=[]
for i in range(size):
g_list.append(torch.DoubleTensor([1.0]))
"

Then problem solved.

What I am guessing is the elements in the list share the same memory location such that as the master received the tensors from workers , it is actually doing multiple write on the same location of memory.

body:
Hey!

When I changed from "g_list=[torch.DoubleTensor([1.0])]*size" to 

"        g_list=[]
        for i in range(size):
            g_list.append(torch.DoubleTensor([1.0]))
"

Then problem solved.

What I am guessing is the elements in the list share the same memory location such that as the master received the tensors from workers , it is actually doing multiple write on the same location of memory.
